page.title: 01Gazetteer.
page.content: A popular feature in the area over recent years, Withern has its own trout farm situated around the building which used to be a water mill for the area. The village comprises of a Methodist Chapel circa mid 19th century, a ruined Anglican church and cemetery, a pair of alms houses, a primary school and a riding stable situated in the old manor house. In regard to local history, an underground passage joins this manor house to the Anglican church and possibly dates back to the time of the English Civil War. The rectory is still used by the priest for this area and has a paddock attached which shows features of strip farming. Situated across the road from the manor is an ancient monument called Castle Hill and moat. Tothill manor is a good example of a 17th. century manorhouse.
